message.content:
{"id": "32770", 
"title": "Bug 32770: Insufficient error message for Java application launch shortcut", 
"description": "Bug 32770: Java application launch shortcut error message does not provide sufficient guidance for the user. Additionally, the quality of the error message needs improvement.", 
"OB": "When attempting to launch a Java application using a shortcut, a dialog appears with the following error message: 'Launch failed: no main type found'. This error message does not provide clear instructions on how to resolve the issue. It would be beneficial to track resource selection in a similar manner as external tools for variable expansion. This would allow for a unified mechanism.", 
"EB": "The error message should provide more specific guidance to the user on how to fix the problem. In this case, the user needs to select a resource. The improved error message should read: 'Launch failed: No file with a main type selected'.", 
"SR": "Enhance the error message for the Java application launch shortcut to provide clearer instructions to the user on how to resolve the issue. Specifically, update the message to state 'Launch failed: No file with a main type selected' when the user needs to select a resource."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '32770', 'title': "Bug 32770Java application launch shortcut error doesn't help user", 'description': "Bug 32770Java application launch shortcut error doesn't help user Also, we should improve the quality of theerror message. ", 'OB': 'A dialog appears: "Launch failed: no main type found".We should consider tracking resource selection the way external tools tracksselection for variable expansion (in fact, we should be able to combine thetwo into a single mechanism?). ', 'EB': 'The message should give the user a hint about what they needto do to fix the problemin this case, they need to select a resource.The message should say something like "Launch failed: No file with a maintype selected" ', 'SR': ''}
